name: LGST 160B
title: International Law
description: Origins and development of international law: international law is examined both as a reflection of the present world order and as a basis for transformation. Topics include state and non-state actors and sovereignty, treaties, the use of force, and human rights.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): satisfaction of the Entry Level Writing and Composition requirements.

class_notes: Enroll in lecture and associated discussion section. Also offered as POLI 160B.
